summary: The “Assisting In Developing Youth Employment Act” (AID Youth Employment Act) amends the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act to provide funding for subsidized summer and year-round employment opportunities for youth aged 14-24. It establishes competitive grant programs for states, local governments, and community-based organizations to develop and implement these programs. The bill defines eligible youth, outlines application requirements, and specifies performance measures and reporting. It authorizes appropriations for the programs.
